article_title: Healthcare Reboot Hits 'Blue Screen Of Death'

article_metadata.description: For years, the biggest single complaint everyone had with Microsoft's Windows operating system was its infamous "Blue Screen of Death." It became known simply (and affectionately) as BSOD. Lost data aside, it always meant a complete system "reboot" was required. That usually entailed pressing the "CTRL+ALT+DEL keys," so it also became known in the software community as the "three-finger-salute." Even if [...]
article_metadata.author: Dan Munro
